definitions.definition: have on one's body or a part of one's body as clothing, decoration, protection, or for some other purpose.
examples: he was wearing a dark suit

definitions.definition: habitually have on one's body or be dressed in.
examples: although she was a widow, she didn't wear black

definitions.definition: exhibit or present (a particular facial expression or appearance).
examples: they wear a frozen smile on their faces

definitions.definition: have (one's hair or beard) at a specified length or arranged in a specified style.
examples: the students wore their hair long

definitions.definition: damage, erode, or destroy by friction or use.
examples: the track has been worn down in part to bare rock
synonyms: dissolve "the bricks have been worn down"

definitions.definition: undergo damage, erosion, or destruction by friction or use.
examples: mountains are wearing down with each passing second

definitions.definition: form (a hole, path, etc.) by constant friction or use.
examples: the water was forced up through holes it had worn
some losses can wear on you

definitions.definition: withstand continued use or life in a specified way.
examples: a carpet-type finish seems to wear well
synonyms: prove durable "the tires are wearing well"

examples: the environmental health people wouldn't wear it

definitions.definition: (of a period of time) pass, especially slowly or tediously.
examples: as the afternoon wore on, he began to look unhappy

definitions.definition: pass (a period of time) in some activity.
examples: spinning long stories, wearing half the day

definitions.definition: bring (a ship) about by turning its head away from the wind.
examples: Shannon gives the order to wear ship
